intro: Smilax luteocaulis, commonly known as the yellow-stem smilax, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial vine characterized by its woody stems and spiny stems, which are often covered in a yellowish or pale green hue. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by red or orange berries. Smilax luteocaulis thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the native flora in its habitat.
